titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to extend the authority to conduct telework travel expenses test programs, and for other purposes.
To amend title 5, United States Code, to extend the authority to conduct telework travel expenses test programs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. H. Rept. 115-460.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 342.

action.text: Mr. Gianforte moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4171.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: This bill extends the authority of federal agencies to conduct telework travel expenses test programs until December 31, 2020.
